meanings.definition: To remove spiritual qualities or significance from something.
meanings.sent1: The scientist tried to despiritualize the ancient artifact by analyzing its chemical composition.
meanings.sent2: The new laws threatened to despiritualize the traditional ceremony by imposing strict regulations.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his morning coffee seemed to despiritualize his usual morning ritual.
meanings.sent4: The bright lights of the city seemed to despiritualize the peaceful countryside, turning it into a bustling metropolis.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds overhead seemed to despiritualize the once sunny day, casting a gloomy shadow over everything.

meanings.definition: To make something less spiritual or sacred.
meanings.sent1: The new technology threatened to despiritualize the ancient temple, making it more of a tourist attraction.
meanings.sent2: The commercialization of the holiday season seemed to despiritualize the religious aspects of the celebrations.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child's antics seemed to despiritualize the solemn atmosphere of the church service.
meanings.sent4: The loud music at the party seemed to despiritualize the peaceful ambiance of the garden.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti on the walls seemed to despiritualize the historic building, diminishing its cultural significance.
